episodes.title: #40 - Listener Calls with Sneaker Steve
episodes.summary:
On Episode 40 I decided to do something a little different and invite my friend Sneaker Steve back on the show to do some listener call-in questions.  We had a great episode last week with Steve and I had been talking to him about doing something like this.  I have set up an email (shortstorypod@gmail.com) that the listeners can send in their questions and phone number which I will be going through and giving some advice & answering questions.  This was a fun episode to do so keep the emails coming and expect more episodes like this in the next few weeks!

 

You can find Sneaker Steve on..

@sneakersteve on Instagram

@androidhomme on Instagram

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #39 - Sneaker Steve: Android Homme/Entrepreneur
episodes.summary:
Episode 39 I have my friend Steve Patiño aka Sneaker Steve whom I've known for the past 10 years or so.  Steve grew up in Queens, New York where he was always up on the latest style from his clothing to his shoes.  His interests were playing basketball, having the best clothes/shoes and hustling.  These interests led him to ditching school and graduating late from high school but something clicked when he decided to attend college. He became a 4.0 student and transferred to an Ivy League school.  Later he started consulting at DC Shoes, started businesses working with Lamar Odom and now at Android Homme. This is a story that you do not want to miss!

You can find Sneaker Steve on..

@sneakersteve on Instagram

@androidhomme on Instagram

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #38 - Caron Butler: NBA Player/Author
episodes.summary:
This week on Short Story Long I have one of the NBA's most respected veterans and now author Caron Butler.  Growing up in Wisconsin, Caron had some very tough obstacles early in his life.  At the age of 11 he became a drug dealer and was arrested 15 times before he had even turned 15 years old.  It wasn't until he spent time in a detention center that he realized the life he was living was going to lead him to more jail time or even getting killed.  Turning to the bible and god, he saw the basketball court at his detention center as a sign and started taking the game seriously.  Once released he turned his life around playing AAU ball and noticing that he could make a career out of basketball if he just stuck to it.  From high school he was offered a scholarship to play for UCONN and was named co-Big East Player of the year as a sophomore.  Drafted by the Miami Heat in 2002, Caron has had an incredible career with stories to go along with it.  Amidst all of his success, Caron has stayed humble and grounded and has gave back to his community and the players that he's been with.  In 2015, he released Tuff Juice: My Journey from the Streets to the NBA.  Listen to episode 38 for Caron's amazing story.

You can find Caron Butler on..

@CaronButler on Instagram

@realtuffjuice on Twitter

caronbutler.com for everything Caron

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #37 - Christopher "Big Black" Boykin
episodes.summary:
On this episode I have a very special guest who you all may know from Rob & Big and Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory, my good friend Christopher "Big Black" Boykin.  Big Black grew up in the city of Chicago until the age of 13 when he moved to Mississippi.  Threw hardships and adversities, the day he graduated high school he packed his bags and was off to the Navy to get away from his surrounds.  Spending 3 years in Guam and being a chef in the Navy he then went back home to Mississippi only to stay for 2 weeks.  Moving again Chris started going to college and started his own security/limo business where he doubled as security and driver.  Around this time he was picked to become Rob Dyrdek's security for the DC Skateboarding Video in which he formed his bond that everyone knows from MTV's Rob & Big.  Moving to LA and filming for the show Chris started his clothing line "Big Black" and had incredible success which is one of the reasons I started my own clothing line.  This episode was really fun to do and I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

 

You can find Big Black and his projects on..

@BigBlack1972 on Instagram & his merch @bbdowork

@BigBlack on Twitter

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #36 - Matt Iseman: TV Host
episodes.summary:
In Episode 36 I sat down with comedian/tv host Matt Iseman who you may know from the show American Ninja Warrior.  I really enjoyed this podcast because I knew of Matt through my friend Orly Shani but I did not know the full details of his story.  Matt grew up in Denver, Colorado as the son of a doctor & stay at home mom who loved sports.  He received his B.S. at Princeton and M.D. from Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons.  Matt moved back to Colorado for his residency in which he decided this may not be the path for him.  He took some time off and moved to California and took his shot at being a comedian.  He immediately knew this is what he wanted and starting working with the improv troupe The Groundlings. In 2010 he started working with American Ninja Warrior and currently on the 8th season of The Celebrity Apprentice.

 

You can find Matt Iseman on..

@MattIseman on Instagram & Twitter

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #35 - DJ Skee: DJ/Producer/TV Host
episodes.summary:
Episode 35 I sit down with world famous dj/producer/tv host/entrepreneur DJ Skee. Scott Keeney better known as DJ Skee grew up in Minnesota and at the age of 15 started DJing.  Starting his career in music he landed a job with Sony/Loud Records and moved out to California.  As Steve Rifkind was handling the music side of the business, Skee took over marketing and was responsible for the exposure of the T-Mobile Sidekick within the music industry.  After leaving Loud he started advising, marketing & even produced 300 Bars by The Game.  Skee is constantly working and creating which is why Mark Cuban dubbed him the "Oprah of Music".  Listen in on how everything started for him and the projects that he's been working on.

 

You can find DJ Skee and his projects on..

@DJSkee & @DashRadio Instagram

@DJSkee on Twitter

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #34 - Todd Tourso: Beyonce's Creative Director
episodes.summary:
Today's episode of Short Story Long is with my good friend Todd Tourso who is the creative director for Beyoncé.  Growing up in Reseda, California, Todd was really into skateboard culture & graffiti which he says still plays a role in his life today.  After high school he started taking graphic design and went to college at ArtCenter College of Design, in Pasadena.  This lead him to create the streetwear brand Plain Gravy which you may be familiar with from the t-shirt "PHARRELL CAN'T SKATE" which also got the attention from Pharrell himself.  Todd has been in streetwear, was the art director for Warner Bros Records, creative director at Flaunt Magazine & also worked with Lady Gaga for a few years. Now currently the creative director for Beyoncé, Todd gives his insight on clothing, art & everything that has shaped him into the career that he has today.

 

@ToddTourso Instagram

 

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

episodes.title: #33 - Christian Guzman: Alphalete Clothing
episodes.summary:
This week I had the chance to talk with a young entrepreneur who has an incredible following from his Youtube Vlogs and his athletic apparel brand Alphalete, Christian Guzman.  At the young age of 23, Christian has already accomplished an incredible amount of success which started from online personal training and documenting his journey on Youtube.  Realizing that being consistent and helping others online could be a career that he enjoys, Christian used that money to open up his own gym which allowed clients and friends to grow with him.  Christian had CGFitness t-shirts that he wanted to expand on so he learned how to source out better fabric to obtain the look and feel that he really wanted and created his brand Alphalete Athletics. Listen in on how Christian has made a name for himself as an entrepreneur and young business owner in the fitness industry while inspiring thousands of people along the way.

 

 

You can find Christian's projects on....

episodes.title: #32 - Ryan Holiday: Author
episodes.summary:
Episode 32 I was fortunate enough to have one of my favorite authors Ryan Holiday sit down with me via Skype.  Ryan is the author of books Trust Me I'm Lying, The Obstacle is the Way & Ego is the Enemy.  He is also a media stategist, marketer & entrepreneur.  Growing up in Southern California, Ryan attended the University of Riverside where he spent 2 years in school before dropping out & taking an internship for writing.  Now being placed into a position that he had strived to be at, Ryan was now working for Tucker Max & Robert Greene.  Taking the knowledge and guidance from both of his mentors Ryan took a job with American Apparel and was soon named marketing director of the brand.  Having an interest in the topic of "media manipulation" Holiday decided to leave American Apparel and move to the east coast to write and publish his first book Trust Me I'm Lying: Confessions of a Media Manipulator.  Find out how Ryan became the successful author that he is today and his journey to get there!

 

 

You can find Ryan on....

@RyanHoliday on Instagram & Twitter

 

www.RyanHoliday.net is his website which has more information his books 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #31 - Aaron Levant: ComplexCon & Agenda Trade Show
episodes.summary:
This week I sit down with the creator of Agenda Trade Show as well as co-creator of ComplexCon Aaron Levant.  Aaron grew up in Agoura Hills, California being a troubled kid who enjoyed graffiti and the lifestyle that came with it.  Aaron was kicked out of high school and sent to boarding schools where he ran away in a taxi and convinced his mom to allow him back home.  While home in Los Angeles he took an internship with GAT (Gypsies and Thieves/Green Apple Tree) and never looked back to his old habits.  Noticing there needed to be a change in how trade shows were going and no prior experience in doing so, Aaron decided to create Agenda Trade Show.  For the last 14 years, Aaron has shaped the way businesses have competed and showcased their product.  Aaron's success with shows and brand development has allowed him to partner with mogul Marc Ecko to create a new form of branding and entertainment called ComplexCon.  Aaron's story in Episode 31 shows you the power of having an interest in something and devoting your life to something you love.

 

You can find Aaron's projects on....

@AgendaShow & @ComplexCon on Instagram and Twitter

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #30 - Omar Benson Miller: Actor
episodes.summary:
Episode 30 is with my good friend Omar Benson Miller who you may recognize from things like 8 Mile, Get Rich or Die Tryin' and HBO's Ballers.  Omar grew up in Los Angeles and went to college at San Jose State University.  Starting in Drama class Omar discovered that he could make money and get paid from acting.  Fully committing to perfecting his craft, Omar was given an opportunity to become represented by an agent and landed his first big movie. That same year he started filming and working with Eminem on the 2002 hit movie, 8 Mile.  Never losing faith Omar has gone from little to no work at times to now being on major shows like CSI: Miami & HBO's Ballers.  Listen to Omar's acting journey and also check out his podcast with his brother Terry called O-Zone.

You can find Omar on....

@OmarBensonMiller on Instagram

@OmarMiller on Twitter

O-Zone Podcast on iTunes

itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/35-o-zone-12-19-16/id1095613676?i=1000379140518&mt=2

 

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #29 - Andy Nguyen: AFTERS ice cream
episodes.summary: This week I'm here with Andy Nguyen, co-founder of AFTERS Ice Cream and many other restaurants based out of Orange County, CA.  Growing up Andy would get into trouble, shoplift, get into fights and did not do well in school.  Andy did not know what he wanted to go to college for or what career path he wanted to get into so he dropped out and started working in real estate.  Enjoying the money but hating the job and realizing that wasn't something he was into, he started working with a friend in clothing.  Wanting the able to express his interests and have his own ideas Andy decided he would partner up and create the streetwear brand IMKING.  During that 7 year period and traveling a lot, he took an interest in the food industry.  In 2014, Andy & his partner Scott created AFTERS Ice Cream which has been highly successful with 9 locations and counting.  Having the willingness to just try something and never being afraid to fail, this episode has everything you need to hear in business.

episodes.title: #28 - Chris Ngo: The Leverage
episodes.summary: On Episode 28 of Short Story Long I sit down with one of the owners of The Leverage Chris Ngo.  Chris grew up in Orange County and started working as a loan officer after college which shortly after he landed a job for the streetwear company Franco Shade.  Attending a tradeshow in Las Vegas, Chris made his first sale and started his career change.  Working as a sales director for multiple brands throughout the years he decided to start his own sales agency.  Knowing the possibility of contracts ending Chris created his first of many brands, Embellish NYC Denim.  Listen in on how Chris has become an entrepreneur with multiple successful brands and the goals he has for the future.

episodes.title: #27 - Jeff Tremaine: Creator of Jackass
episodes.summary:
"Commit To It"

This episode of Short Story Long is with my friend, director/producer/writer and creator of Jackass, Jeff Tremaine.  Jeffs creator and executive producer credits stretch beyond just Jackass and into other hit shows like Wild Boyz, Rob & Big, Nitro Circus, Rob Dyrdek's Fantasy Factory and The Dudesons in America.  Jackass: The Movie, Jackass Number Two, Jackass 3D and Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa are all directed and produced by Jeff and have all hit #1 in the country.  Listen in on how Jeff started his career by helping start Big Brother magazine and the crazy stories he has had over the years working with people like Spike Jones, Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Chris Pontius, and Steve-O.

episodes.title: #26 - Nick Diamond: Diamond Supply co.
episodes.summary:
This week I sit down with Diamond Supply Co owner, Nick Diamond. Nick tells me his story about growing up in northern California, skateboarding and getting into to trouble and how he turned that into the multi million dollar Diamond Supply Co. empire. From selling weed and spare skateboard parts to get by while living in group homes to eventually moving to Los Angeles to take a shot at making his clothing brand/skateboard hardware company a real business. Nick started small by handing out clothes to his close friends and eventually grew his brand to the point of selling in stores like Supreme, Zumiez and Pac Sun and collaborating massive artists like Wiz Khalifa, Rick Ross, and Currency. Nick truly has a rags to riches story and its one that you don't want to miss.

You can find Nick and Diamond on....

DiamondSupplyco.com

@NickyDiamonds on Instagram

and

@Nicky_Diamante on snapchat

Don't forget to leave feedback on the iTunes store and let me know what you think of this episode and you can also reach me at 

@Drama on Instagram

@DramaDrama on Twitter

and

@DramaDrama on Snapchat

 

www.YoungandReckless.com

episodes.title: #25 - shelby and sandy: Artist & Brother duo
episodes.summary:
"Never Enough Time"

This week I sit down with my talented friends Shelby and Sandy.  These two have an incredible bond that only brothers share and it shows in their work and daily lives.  Shelby (8 years senior to Sandy) went to USC for political science and later worked for Rob Dyrdek's manager as his assistant. While Sandy attended USC as an art major, they would work together and bounce ideas off each other with art pieces.  Realizing that being an assistant wasn't for him, Shelby quit to start a career with his brother Sandy.  Shelby and Sandy's love for art and their extensive work ethic leaves them with never enough time in the day.  Doing pieces for celebrities like Drake, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, Zac Efron, Rachel Zoe, Nipsey Hussle, Karrueche Tran, Sean Kingston, and Kid Ink.  These two have made a name for themselves and are just getting started.  Listen in on their journey and see how this family became successful working with each other.

episodes.title: #24 -  Alvin Cailan: Chef/Entrepreneur
episodes.summary:
"Don't Sacrifice Quality"

 

On Episode 24 I have co-founder/executive chef of the highly successful restaurant Eggslut, Alvin Cailan.  Growing up in Los Angeles, Alvin was taught at the young age of 7 the importance of having great work ethic from his daily chore of cooking rice for his dad.  To this day he has this embedded into his brain and applies it to everything in his life.  After dabbling in the streetwear scene Alvin moved to Oregon telling no one but his brother.  Learning Farm-to-Table Alvin worked for free and juggled jobs to become a great chef and perfect his craft.  With passion and great drive he took his experiences and created his own restaurant Eggslut.  Years later Alvin now owns multiple businesses and has had amazing success. Listen in on his story and what it took to become great while helping others achieve their dreams through cooking.

episodes.title: #23 - Liane V: Entertainer/Influencer
episodes.summary:
"Make It On Your Own"
 
This week I sit down with Liane V. Liane grew up in Modesto, California and moved to Los Angeles immediately after graduating high school. Working odd jobs Liane always had a vision of being a singer and entertainer. While in LA she became friends with YouTube star DeStorm Power who introduced her to the social media platform Vine.  With rapid success Liane became one of the biggest names on Vine and Musical.ly which opened up opportunities to work with celebrities like Kevin Hart and Justin Bieber as well as major companies like Starbucks and McDonald's. Even though she has a lot more that she plans to accomplish she talks with me about how she's been able to help her parents retire and move to Los Angeles to be closer to her. Her dad has even become a mini star on his own just from making appearances in her videos. Listen in on Liane's success and her guidance on following a dream and creating your own lane.

episodes.title: #22 - Anthony Saleh: Manager of Future & Nas
episodes.summary:
"Focus On What's Important"

This week I sit down with my friend Anthony Saleh. Anthony talks about his extremely humble childhood in Southern California and the skills that it taught him. Going on to manage artists like Nas & Future and even starting a venture capital fund with guidance from friends and mentors like Ben Horowitz, Anthony has always found a way to succeed by having a strategy and being tactical. Always learning, listening and being respectful Anthony has used his solid foundation to accomplish an amazing amount at only 30 years old, even making the Forbes 30 under 30 list in 2015.

episodes.title: #21 - Joe Huff: LSTN Headphones
episodes.summary:
"Find a Balance"

On Episode 21 I sit down with my friend Joe Huff.  As a teenager Joe struggled with drugs but turned his life around working tough jobs.  Starting his own companies to working with charities, Joe now owns Lstn which is a for-purpose company that has partnered with Starkey Hearing Foundation to help provide hearing aids for every purchase.  Listen in as this is a great episode for learning how you can plan and balance your life to succeed.

episodes.title: #20 - Shep Gordon: The Legend!
episodes.summary: "Find the Miracle" This week on episode 20 I sit down with the legendary Shep Gordon. Starting off in the music industry as Alice Cooper's manager, Shep had the gift to make people famous. Not only did he help create Alice Cooper but also had huge clients such as Luther Vandross, Blondie, Janis Joplin, Anne Murray, Teddy Pendergrass and even Pink Floyd. Everything from fabricating genius PR stunts to creating the concept for the celebrity chef, Shep shares his stories and wisdom on business and how "the journey is as important as getting there”.

episodes.title: #19 - Me
episodes.summary: "My Story" This week I sit down with Anoush Moin and Joe Rausch from the 'Mama, We Made It!' podcast to flip the normal routine and talk about my life from growing up in Akron, Ohio to where I'm at now. Stories I haven't told from being the assistant to Rob Dyrdek to being on Rob & Big, Fantasy Factory and then creating Young & Reckless and now this podcast. Listen as we discuss a lot of my stories and inspirations that led me to want to tell these stories and share these conversations with other young successful entrepreneurs and entertainers.

episodes.title: #18 - Mike Stud: Rapper
episodes.summary: "Stay the Course" This week on Episode 18 of Short Story Long I sit down with recording artist Mike Stud. Star baseball player in high school, Mike earns a scholarship to Duke University and set a school record in pitching. Coming off an amazing year, Mike needed elbow surgery and decided to rap on his downtime which led to his career in hip hop. Listen in on his journey and where it's taken him.

episodes.title: #17 - Rob Dyrdek (Pt. 2)
episodes.summary: "Data First, Then Put In The Soul" On Episode 17 we continue the interview with Rob Dyrdek. In Part 2, Rob talks about planning and preparation to the principals of his life. Implementing the importance of how a business actually works and managing that business, Rob gives insight on what he'd like to tell his 20 year old self and things he'd change.

episodes.title: #16 - Rob Dyrdek: Entrepreneur/Pro Skateboarder/TV Personality
episodes.summary: "Create Opportunity" This week on episode 16 I sit down with my cousin & mentor Rob Dyrdek. If you're not familiar, Rob is a professional skateboarder/entrepreneur/pop-culture personality that can turn his ideas into reality. In Part 1, Rob gives insight to "sustainable long term success" and how that has become embedded into his life. From childhood soccer to cold calling skateshops, Rob explains how he started skating and what it took to become pro.

episodes.title: #15 - Ruben Fleischer: Director/Producer
episodes.summary: "Go For Broke" This week I sit down with my good friend Ruben Fleischer. Originally from Washington D.C., Ruben moved to San Francisco doing odd jobs like learning HTML programming, being a bus boy & eventually moving to LA. After landing some PA jobs and falling in love with film, he spent all of his cash on a VX1000 camcorder and just went for it... Ruben has gone on to produce a handful of successful commercials, tv shows & movies like Zombieland, 30 Minutes or Less & Gangster Squad.

episodes.title: #14 - Bobby Hundreds: The Hundreds
episodes.summary: "Protect Your Brand" On episode 14 I sit down with Chief Creative Officer & Co-Founder of The Hundreds, Bobby Hundreds. Bobby talks about his childhood growing up in Riverside, CA, his love for art, and law school where he'd meet his business partner in The Hundreds. Following the advice of his mentor, Bobby leaves law behind to share his vision through clothing. We talk about everything from early days of him blogging to the current state of streetwear and where he sees it going in the future.

episodes.title: #13 - Jo Koy: Comedian/Podcaster
episodes.summary: "The Journey Is the Reward" On today's episode of Short Story Long I have my friend, comedian, and fellow podcaster, Jo Koy. Jo has amazing stories that really gives you insight on how to become successful by trusting in the process and being persistent. Through hard work and trial & error, Jo takes us through his life from his first applause break at a coffee house to Showtime At the Apollo and now his own comedy specials.

episodes.title: #12 - Futuristic & Jerry Purpdrank
episodes.summary: "Trial and Error" This week I sit down with Indie Hip-Hop artist Futuristic and Vine star Jerry Purpdrank. Originally from Illinois, Futuristic started rapping at the age of 6 and has been hustling ever since. With about 30 videos with over 100 million collective views, Futuristic chats with us about everything from recording raps with his brother as a child to booking his own tours and moving to LA. Boston native & social media star "Jerry Purpdrank" gives us his story on how he became one of the biggest names on Vine and his progression into other platforms. Now residing in Los Angeles, Jerry is using his social media to open other opportunities for himself.

episodes.title: #11 - Shane Nickerson: SuperJacket Productions
episodes.summary: “Just Take the First Step” This week I sit down with executive producer Shane Nickerson. He’s produced the shows I’ve been on (e.g. Rob and Big, Fantasy Factory) as well as “Crashletes”. Shane shares his insight on his move to LA as a struggling actor and his transition from actor to story editor to finally executive producer.

episodes.title: #10 -  BJ the Chicago Kid: Singer
episodes.summary: "Trust Your Instincts" Growing up in Southside of Chicago, Illinois, BJ has seen it all and paid his dues. From witnessing a family member get robbed to breaking into the industry as a gospel backup singer. As he gets ready to headline his own world-wide tour BJ stops by the showroom where we talk about our current societal issues and dive into his journey as an artist.

episodes.title: #9 - Brendan Schaub: The Fighter & The Kid
episodes.summary: This week I chat with "Fighter and the Kid" podcaster Brendan Schaub. Brendan talks about his younger years playing sports, fighting in the UFC and appearing on The Ultimate Fighter on Spike and how he left all of that behind to follow his dream of a successful career in entertainment. Brendan now co hosts his hugely successful podcast, does live shows around the country and has a TV show in partnership with Fox. This is a great story of following your intuition and working until you make your dreams come true.

episodes.title: #8 - Andrew Santino & Nick Kreiss: Comedian/Writers
episodes.summary: This week I talk to Andrew Santino & Nick Kreiss. Andrew is an comedian/actor and Nick is a writer/director/producer. The two of them just sold their first movie to Sony with Nick directing and with Andrew as the star. I first met them on the set of “Punk’d” about 6 years ago and since then they have made incredible progress in their careers. In this episode we get into everything from Andrew's college days thinking he would become a superstar rapper to their rise to success while remaining sane and humble.

episodes.title: #7 - Matt Rife: Comedian
episodes.summary: This week Matt Rife joins us. Originally from my home state of Ohio, Matt started doing standup at 15. Fast forward 5 years later and he’s now on MTV's Wild ’n Out, and doing stand up around the country. Listen as we discuss what its been like for Matt moving to Los Angeles and chasing his dreams in the Hollywood.

episodes.title: #6 - Paul "P-Rod" Rodriguez: Pro Skateboarder/Entrepreneur
episodes.summary: This week I get the Short Story Long from Paul “P-Rod” Rodriguez. Growing up in Simi Valley, Paul became a pro skateboarder at the age of 16. Arguably one of the greatest skaters ever and also one of the most business savvy. Paul has founded/invested in Primitive Skateboards, Saint Archer Brewery and multiple other businesses. Listen to us chat about how he’s done what he’s done and his plans for all things skateboarding and business moving forward.

episodes.title: #5 - Brian Atlas: Street League Skateboarding
episodes.summary: In episode 5 I sit down with a good friend of mine Brian Atlas. Originally from New Jersey, Brian moved to LA graduated from USC and became the president and co-founder of Street League Skateboarding.

episodes.title: #4 - Kanya Sesser: Inspiring Human Being!
episodes.summary: "Live Your Life" This week I sit down with my friend Kanya Sesser. Born with no legs in Thailand and found on the steps of a buddhist temple, Kanya gives us insight on how she lives her life without limitations.

episodes.title: #3 - Eric DLux: DJ/Music Producer
episodes.summary: "From Humble Beginnings to Radio” On this episode I sit down with longtime friend DJ/Producer, Eric Dlux. We cover everything from Eric being initially inspired by a DJ at a backyard party in his hometown of Carson, CA to working at Power 106 and producing hit records like “Shots” with LMFAO.

episodes.title: #2 - Dee Murthy: Young & Reckless/Five Four Clothing
episodes.summary: “Creating Something From Nothing” In Episode 2 I sit down with my good friend, business partner, and FiveFour co-founder, Dee Murthy. Dee is a seasoned entrepreneur, investor and executive in several successful fashion and celebrity focused ventures. Get an inside look on trials and tribulations to starting your own brand.

episodes.title: #1 - A talk with Rod Kurtz
episodes.summary: "Are Entrepreneurs Born or Made?" Welcome to ‘Short Story Long’ - In this first episode I sit down with friend and journalist Rod Kurtz and dive into the age old debate, are entrepreneurs born or made? Rod, a media consultant for a variety of brands, organizations and startups breaks it down and explains.
